data.q: Which keyword is used to handle exceptions in Python?
data.e: The try keyword is used to wrap code that may raise an exception so it can be handled safely.

data.q: Which block is used to catch and handle an exception?
data.e: The except block is executed when an exception occurs in the corresponding try block.

data.q: Which block will always execute whether an exception occurs or not?
data.e: The finally block always runs, making it useful for cleanup actions like closing files.

data.q: What happens if an exception is not handled in a Python program?
o: The program terminates with a traceback
data.e: If an exception is not handled, Python stops execution and prints a traceback showing the error.

data.q: Which keyword is used to explicitly raise an exception?
data.e: The raise keyword is used to explicitly trigger an exception in Python.

data.q: Which of the following is a built-in Python exception?
data.e: IndexError is a built-in exception raised when accessing a list index out of range.

data.q: What exception is raised when dividing by zero?
data.e: ZeroDivisionError is raised when a number is divided by zero in Python.

data.q: Which block executes only if no exception occurs?
data.e: The else block runs only when the try block completes without raising any exceptions.

data.q: How can you catch multiple exceptions in a single except block?
data.e: Multiple exceptions can be caught by specifying them as a tuple in a single except clause.

data.q: Which statement is commonly used for debugging and raises an exception if a condition is false?
data.e: The assert statement is used for debugging and raises an AssertionError if the condition is false.
